column4: Can someone assist me with Virtual Machine topic? Do I need to have my own Windows disc in order to install Windows into a virtual machine? And is it better to run Windows applications (Adobe Master Collection Suite 5) onto the virtual machine, or will it be incredibly slow on performance? (pushing 3.6ghz with 6gb of ram)
ya JPP... but I fear that WINE might crash while in the middle of my work... cannot afford that at the very moment lol... client really needs a website by the end of Monday :P

technically you don't need the physical media to install win into a VM.  you can use an .iso .  There are licensing issues which I have no clue about.  The only way to really know if the speed will be tolerable is to try.
